00051 
00052 #if defined(HEADER_RC4_H)
00053 #if !defined(RC4_INT)
00054 /* using int types make the structure larger but make the code faster
00055  * on most boxes I have tested - up to %20 faster. */
00056 /*
00057  * I don't know what does "most" mean, but declaring "int" is a must on:
00058  * - Intel P6 because partial register stalls are very expensive;
00059  * - elder Alpha because it lacks byte load/store instructions;
00060  */
00061 #define RC4_INT unsigned int
00062 #endif
00063 #if !defined(RC4_CHUNK)
00064 /*
00065  * This enables code handling data aligned at natural CPU word
00066  * boundary. See crypto/rc4/rc4_enc.c for further details.
00067  */
00068 #undef RC4_CHUNK
00069 #endif
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #if (defined(HEADER_NEW_DES_H) || defined(HEADER_DES_H)) && !defined(DES_LONG)
00073 /* If this is set to 'unsigned int' on a DEC Alpha, this gives about a
00074  * %20 speed up (longs are 8 bytes, int's are 4). */
00075 #ifndef DES_LONG
00076 #define DES_LONG unsigned long
00077 #endif
00078 #endif
00079

00129 #if defined(HEADER_DES_LOCL_H) && !defined(CONFIG_HEADER_DES_LOCL_H)
00130 #define CONFIG_HEADER_DES_LOCL_H
00131 #ifndef DES_DEFAULT_OPTIONS
00132 /* the following is tweaked from a config script, that is why it is a
00133  * protected undef/define */
00134 #ifndef DES_PTR
00135 #undef DES_PTR
00136 #endif
00137 
00138 /* This helps C compiler generate the correct code for multiple functional
00139  * units.  It reduces register dependancies at the expense of 2 more
00140  * registers */
00141 #ifndef DES_RISC1
00142 #undef DES_RISC1
00143 #endif
00144 
00145 #ifndef DES_RISC2
00146 #undef DES_RISC2
00147 #endif
00148 
00149 #if defined(DES_RISC1) && defined(DES_RISC2)
00150 YOU SHOULD NOT HAVE BOTH DES_RISC1 AND DES_RISC2 DEFINED!!!!!
00151 #endif
00152 
00153 /* Unroll the inner loop, this sometimes helps, sometimes hinders.
00154  * Very mucy CPU dependant */
00155 #ifndef DES_UNROLL
00156 #undef DES_UNROLL
00157 #endif
00158 
00159 /* These default values were supplied by
00160  * Peter Gutman <pgut001@cs.auckland.ac.nz>
00161  * They are only used if nothing else has been defined */
00162 #if !defined(DES_PTR) && !defined(DES_RISC1) && !defined(DES_RISC2) && !defined(DES_UNROLL)
00163 /* Special defines which change the way the code is built depending on the
00164    CPU and OS.  For SGI machines you can use _MIPS_SZLONG (32 or 64) to find
00165    even newer MIPS CPU's, but at the moment one size fits all for
00166    optimization options.  Older Sparc's work better with only UNROLL, but
00167    there's no way to tell at compile time what it is you're running on */
00168  
00169 #if defined( sun )      /* Newer Sparc's */
00170 #  define DES_PTR
00171 #  define DES_RISC1
00172 #  define DES_UNROLL
00173 #elif defined( __ultrix )   /* Older MIPS */
00174 #  define DES_PTR
00175 #  define DES_RISC2
00176 #  define DES_UNROLL
00177 #elif defined( __osf1__ )   /* Alpha */
00178 #  define DES_PTR
00179 #  define DES_RISC2
00180 #elif defined ( _AIX )      /* RS6000 */
00181   /* Unknown */
00182 #elif defined( __hpux )     /* HP-PA */
00183   /* Unknown */
00184 #elif defined( __aux )      /* 68K */
00185   /* Unknown */
00186 #elif defined( __dgux )     /* 88K (but P6 in latest boxes) */
00187 #  define DES_UNROLL
00188 #elif defined( __sgi )      /* Newer MIPS */
00189 #  define DES_PTR
00190 #  define DES_RISC2
00191 #  define DES_UNROLL
00192 #elif defined(i386) || defined(__i386__)    /* x86 boxes, should be gcc */
00193 #  define DES_PTR
00194 #  define DES_RISC1
00195 #  define DES_UNROLL
00196 #endif /* Systems-specific speed defines */
00197 #endif
00198 
00199 #endif /* DES_DEFAULT_OPTIONS */
00200 #endif /* HEADER_DES_LOCL_H */
